law.catch_line: of order modified in another state.
law.text:
If a child support order issued by a tribunal of this state is modified by a tribunal of another state which assumed jurisdiction pursuant to a law substantially similar to KRS 407.5101 to 407.5902, a tribunal of this state:
May enforce its order that was modified only as to arrears and interest accruing before the modification;
May provide appropriate relief for violations of its order which occurred before the effective date of the modification; and
Shall recognize the modifying order of the other state, upon registration, for the purpose of enforcement.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 2015 Ky. Acts ch. 18, sec. 51, effective June 24, 2015. -- Contingent effective date repealed 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 101, sec. 20, effective March 23, 1998. -- Created 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 365, sec. 57, effective upon contingency.
